intro: Adenosacme, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plants typically have a short, thick stem and produce vibrant blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. Adenosacme species are popular as houseplants due to their ease of care and ornamental value. They prefer bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
